business.headline: Mehli Mistry steps down from NCPA board, Tata Trusts' Vijay Singh replaces him: ReportMehli Mistry was on the NCPA council as a nominee of the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and served alongside other Trusts' representatives, including Jehangir H. Jehangir and Pramit Jhaveri.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as investors cautious ahead of US Fed policy decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 436.41 points to close at 84,666.28, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 120.90 points to end at 25,839.65.

Still waiting for your tax refund? 5 common ITR errors and how to correct themIf your tax refund is taking longer than usual, you're not the only one. In most cases, the delay isn't due to the system but small filing mistakes that can easily be fixed.

Anil Ambani's son Jai Anmol named in Rs 228 crore banking fraud case by CBIThe complaint alleges cheating, criminal conspiracy and criminal misconduct that led to a wrongful loss of Rs 228.06 crore to the bank involved.

Wakefit vs Corona: Which IPO offers the best value? Check detailsIn terms of demand, Corona Remedies is witnessing stronger interest from investors. As of December 9, 2025, the Corona Remedies IPO is subscribed 1.78 times overall

Kaynes Technology shares jump over 9% today: Why is the stock rising?The rebound comes amid bargain hunting and selective buying after the recent correction was triggered by a critical report from Kotak, which flagged gaps in disclosures and raised concerns around the company's working capital position.

Rupee weakness, liquidity stress: Why Sensex and Nifty are under pressureIn the past few sessions, benchmark indices have stayed under pressure. Is the falling rupee to blame, or is foreign selling creating a liquidity squeeze? Here's why Dalal Street is on edge.

Can gold maintain its upward momentum despite today's decline?Gold and silver prices remain cautious as investors await the US Federal Reserve's interest rate decision, with experts highlighting recent market trends and key support levels.

Proposed insurance ombudsman rules: What policyholders should knowThe Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) recently released the Draft Internal Insurance Ombudsman Guidelines, 2025. These rules propose a new accountability structure inside insurance companies to speed up dispute resolution and reduce harassment of consumers.

Are new ITR forms coming before FY28? Here's what the government saysThe Indian government is preparing to implement a new Income Tax Act from April 1, 2026. This article examines the upcoming changes to tax forms, the timeline for notification, and the government's efforts to simplify compliance for taxpayers.

Sensex falls over 700 points: Why is the stock market down today?The Sensex has slipped over 700 points to fall below 84,400, while the Nifty has tumbled below 25,800, led by losses in banking, metal, and IT stocks.
Sensex opens 350 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; Kotak Bank down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 400.82 points to 84,701.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 134.80 points to 25,825.75 as of 9:24 am.
Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market fall again?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,964.5 around 8:03 am, hinting that the Nifty 50 might open close to Monday's closing level of 25,960.55.

Meesho, Aequs IPO debut: Can these listings make you rich? GMP gives a hintMeesho and Aequs shares are set for their stock market debut on December 10. Both IPOs attracted robust investor attention during the bidding phase.

Trump greenlights Nvidia H200 AI chip sales to China as US gets 25% cutDonlad Trump said that he had informed President Xi Jinping of China, where Nvidia's chips are under government scrutiny, about the move and he "responded positively," according to Trump's post.

Trump considers fresh tariffs on Indian rice as US farmers allege unfair dumpingThis comes after US farmers urged tougher action, arguing that subsidised rice imports are battering US markets and pushing domestic prices down. Donald Trump vowed to "take care" of the issue and pressed officials to identify countries accused of undercutting US markets.
Monopolies, duopolies and oligopolies: IndiGo's unique grip on global marketNo airline in any major market of the world dominates its home skies like IndiGo does.

Paramount's $108 billion hostile bid for Warner Bros amid Netflix's merger plansNetflix had appeared to clinch the deal on Friday after a weeks-long bidding battle with Paramount and Comcast, securing a $72 billion equity agreement for Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film studio, and streaming businesses.
Will your home loan EMIs fall as HDFC, PNB, and 3 other banks cut lending rates?With several banks adjusting their lending rates downwards, home loan customers may soon notice a drop in their EMIs.

Credit negative: Moody's slams IndiGo for chaos, cites lapses in regulatory planningIndiGo's recent flight chaos has drawn sharp criticism from Moody's, which says the airline failed to prepare for regulatory changes despite having ample time.

entertainment.headline: James Cameron's had a $2 billion argument against splitting Avatar 2 script Facing pushback for expanding the 'Avatar' saga to five films, James Cameron challenged the studio's concern for making "another $2 billion." While 'The Way of Water' validated his confidence, the future of 'Avatar 5' now depends on 'Fire and Ash' crossing the $2 billion global mark.

Zeeshan Ayyub hopes Real Kashmir FC changes mainstream perception of the state Zeeshan Ayyub shares his emotional journey with the Real Kashmir FC series. The show aims to shift the narrative around Kashmir by focusing on human stories beyond politics.

Himesh Reshammiya hits 1.2 billion streams on Spotify, surprises fans with live show Himesh Reshammiya held a special Spotify fan meet to mark his milestone of surpassing 1.2 billion streams on the platform. The event featured live performances, fan interactions, and a heartfelt tribute to actor Dharmendra.

Darshan's The Devil set for huge first-day first-show release, 150 shows booked The Devil, starring Darshan and directed by Prakash Veer, is set to achieve the largest first day opening on single screens in Karnataka, with over 150 early morning shows scheduled and unprecedented ticket sales ahead of its December 11 premiere.

I saw RRR 100 times: Teary-eyed Japanese fan tells Ram Charan, video goes viral A group of Japanese fans travelled to Hyderabad to meet Ram Charan, and one of them grew emotional as she told the actor she had watched RRR "100 times."

Tamannaah Bhatia to play V Shantaram's second wife in biopic. See 1st look poster Actor Tamannaah Bhatia is set to play cinema icon V Shantaram's second wife, Jayashree. The makers unveiled her first look poster today.

Aishwarya Rai clarifies Aaradhya is not on social media, flags fake profile Actor Aishwarya Rai Bachchan recently addressed speculation regarding her daughter Aaradhya's social media presence. She was speaking to the media on the sidelines of the Red Sea Film Festival.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 92: Major twists hit the house as Sanjana lands in jail With the finale fast approaching, Bigg Boss Telugu 9 entered a high-pressure phase on Monday, pushing contestants through emotionally charged tasks and unexpected twists that reshaped the race for the next finalist.

Actor Bhagyalakshmi resigns from Kerala film body over move to reinstate Dileep Bhagyalakshmi has resigned from FEFKA, protesting the federation's move to reinstate actor Dileep soon after his acquittal in the actor assault case. She criticised film bodies for prioritising influence over survivor support and vowed to leave all organisations that fail to stand with women.

What Karachi's Lyari thinks of Dhurandhar and Ranveer Singh? Check this out Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar trailer has sparked witty reactions in Karachi's Lyari neighbourhood. Locals responded with humour and pride.

Dhurandhar proves India can handle the truth without burning a bus The masses, which were always handled by the kid gloves of the intellectual elite, quarantined from the harsh past lest they revolt, have suddenly started accessing history beyond their textbooks.

Indie singer Sufr reveals the inspiration behind his viral hit Bargad Indie singer Sufr's song 'Bargad', inspired by a real-life love story, is trending across music platforms. The collaboration with influencer-singer Arpit Bala has earned over 5 million views. In an exclusive interview, Sufr shared his muse for the song and busted a few myths.

Ranbir doesn't carry 1% of his legacy, that guy is something else: Piyush Mishra During a recent interview, veteran actor Piyush Mishra shared his views on working with Ranbir Kapoor, highlighting the actor's unique disconnection from his cinematic lineage, and reflected on his experiences with the late Irrfan Khan.

Bhay – The Gaurav Tiwari Mystery trailer: Internet reacts to Karan, Kalki starrer The trailer for 'Bhay - The Gaurav Tiwari Mystery' starring Karan Tacker and Kalki Koechlin is out now. The upcoming series is inspired by the life of India's first paranormal investigator. Check out how the Internet has reacted to the trailer.

Ranveer's Dhurandhar look designer Preetisheel Singh calls him Man of the hour Makeup and character designer Preetisheel Singh D'souza praised Ranveer Singh's dedication in Dhurandhar, sharing heartfelt BTS moments and calling his craft consistently inspiring. She also highlighted their long-standing collaboration, rooted in trust, hard work and creative evolution.

Yash in a bloody bathtub: Toxic makers mark 100 days to release with fierce poster The team behind Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups has marked 100 days before its release by unveiling a new poster. Yash and Geetu Mohandas' actioner will hit theatres in March 2026.

Real Kashmir Football Club review: Kashmir's struggle and hope through footballRelease Date:Tue Dec 09, 2025 Real Kashmir Football Club series review: The SonyLiv series depicts the real-life origin of Kashmir's first professional football team. The series highlights the region's socio-political challenges and the resilience of its youth.

Jack Sparrow x Rooh Baba: Kartik Aaryan's epic selfie with Johnny Depp goes viral Bollywood actor Kartik Aaryan shared a memorable moment with Hollywood star Johnny Depp at the Red Sea Film Festival, sparking excitement among fans.

Border 2 first look: Ahan Shetty embodies bravery in tense combat-ready poster The first look poster of Ahan Shetty from 'Border 2' has been unveiled, showing the actor in a powerful action moment. The poster shows Shetty's character amid combat, adding to the anticipation ahead of the film's January 2026 release.

general news.headline: Why does PM want to pick poll chief without CJI? Rahul Gandhi's 3 questions for governmentTalking about electoral reforms in the Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi said he is part of the panel in charge of selecting the poll body chief and other election commissioners as the Leader of the Opposition, but claimed he had no voice since he was outnumbered.

Duty rules non-negotiable: Minister talks tough on IndiGo, bats for new airlinesThe Aviation Minister said IndiGo operations were stabilising across airports even as he firmly underscored that no airline, however large, would be permitted to cause such hardships to passengers.

Live: Live: Election Commission colluding with those in power to shape elections, alleges Rahul GandhiParliament Winter Session Live Updates: A day after PM Narendra Modi initiated the Vande Mataram discussion in the Lok Sabha, the Opposition kicked off a debate on election reforms in the Lower House today. While Congress MP Manish Tewari opened the two-day debate, Leader of the Opposition, Rahul Gandhi, is expected to join later. The opposition has been seeking a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls since Parliament's Monsoon Session, but the Centre suggested a broader debate on election reforms, noting that the Election Commission is an independent constitutional body. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

Goa CM orders demolition of another Luthra club; Blue Corner notice issuedGoa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant has ordered immediate demolition of illegal clubs run by the Luthra brothers following the tragic fire at their Arpora nightclub that claimed 25 lives. The government has intensified its crackdown amid allegations of political protection and years of ignored complaints.

Pakistan: Karachi on boil as demand for separate Sindhudesh sparks violenceThe violence started after protesters hit the streets on Sindhi Culture Day, demanding a separate Sindhudesh. The protesters called for the liberation of Sindh, amplifying a longstanding sentiment of Sindhi nationalist parties.

IndiGo CEO says ops stable, focus on restoring flights on war footingEven as nearly 500 IndiGo flights were cancelled today amid an operational meltdown, CEO Pieter Elbers claimed that the airline is back on its feet and the airline was working to restore the network and flights on a "war footing".

After decades, Pakistan to be divided again; more harm than good, say expertsAfter decades of political hesitation, the long-debated proposal of administrative restructuring of Pakistan is back on the table. Pakistani minister Abdul Aleem Khan has said that carving out smaller provinces is now inevitable. However, experts say that the proposal could do more harm than good.

Humayun Kabir flooded with calls after Humayun Kabir's Babri Masjid appealSuspended Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir's call for donations for a Babri Masjid-style mosque in Bengal has ended with his fellow namesake MLA getting flooded with endless phone calls.

350 players in auction shortlist, in-form wicketkeeper makes surprise entryThe BCCI has unveiled the full list of players finalised for the IPL 2026 auction scheduled to be held in Abu Dhabi on December 16. 240 Indians and 110 overseas players will go under the hammer during the bidding event.

Seven-storey building catches fire in Indonesia's Jakarta, 20 killedThick black smoke billowed into the sky as flames rapidly spread through the structure, triggering panic among nearby residents and office workers in the busy Central Jakarta neighbourhood. The fire started on the first floor around midday, spreading to the upper levels where some employees were having lunch while others were outside.

India an ally against China, boost trade: US policy paper dismisses PakThe new US National Security Strategy casts India and the Quad as central to Washington's plan for the Indo-Pacific, while issuing its toughest takedown of China yet. Europe gets a warning to stand on its own feet, and Pakistan appears only once in the US' strategic roadmap document.

Akshaye Khanna's viral Dhurandhar dance was fully spontaneous: Actor Danish PandorAkshaye Khanna's viral entry scene in Dhurandhar has captured the internet, with Danish Pandor sharing that the actor's crowd-pleasing dance was completely improvised. How surge in divorce cases forced Chola-era Bengaluru temple to bar weddingsThe 12th-century Someshwara Temple in Bengaluru has stopped hosting marriages after priests were spending more time in court than in rituals. Rising divorce cases and fake documents from eloping couples prompted the Ulsoor temple, built in the Chola period, to halt ceremonies to protect its image and avoid legal hassles.

Rules must ease life, not trouble people: PM's message for ministers, MPs at NDA meetPrime Minister Modi told NDA lawmakers that there should not be any such law or rule that unnecessarily troubles the common citizens. He was addressing a meeting of NDA MPs when he made this comment.

Nearly 500 IndiGo flights cancelled today; Centre cuts airline's routes by 5%In response to the large-scale disruptions, the Ministry of Civil Aviation (MoCA) has directed IndiGo to reduce 5 per cent of its winter schedule flights.

Ahmedabad couple's dispute over onion-garlic ends in divorce after 11 years of marriageAn Ahmedabad couple's 11-year marriage ended in divorce over a dispute about onion and garlic use, which led to the wife taking the case to Gujarat High Court.

41 years, tender eyes: Shabana Azmi's heartfelt note for Javed Akhtar wins heartsShabana Azmi and Javed Akhtar marked 41 years of marriage on December 9. On the occasion, a heartfelt post from the actor prompted a wave of congratulatory messages from colleagues and well-wishers across the film industry. Check it out here.

While 'The Way of Water' validated his confidence, the future of 'Avatar 5' now depends on 'Fire and Ash' crossing the $2 billion global mark.

sports.headline: Live Score 1st T20I: India look for winning start in Cuttack India (IND) vs South Africa (SA), 1st T20I Live Score: At the Barabati Stadium in Cuttack, India will look to make a winning start in what's supposed to be the beginning of preparations for the T20 World Cup to be held next year.

His body keeps letting him down: Wood's Ashes exit soul-destroying, says Hussain Nasser Hussain has claimed that Mark Wood's body keeps on letting him down as the pacer was ruled out of the Ashes 2025-26 series after another injury setback on Tuesday, December 9.

How's Sunny Leone connected to cricket? R Ashwin's cryptic tweet explained R Ashwin's cryptic post featuring Sunny Leone and a street photo was actually a playful hint toward young cricketer Sunny Sandhu. The clever wordplay helped spotlight Sandhu's recent heroics in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

Did Wasim Akram take a dig at IPL? Legendary pacer questions length of T20 leagues At a PCB event ahead of the 2026 edition, Wasim Akram drew comparisons between the PSL and other T20 leagues, mentioning that PSL's compact and high-tempo format is a lot better than other lengthy T20 leagues.

Is Sanju Samson set for another long stint on the bench? Sanju Samson appears likely to miss out on India's playing XI as the team begins its preparations for the T20 World Cup 2026, with Jitesh Sharma emerging as the preferred wicketkeeper-batter option. India will play 10 T20Is — five against South Africa and another five against New Zealand — in the lead-up to the marquee event, starting in February.

Cheap sensationalism: Hardik Pandya slams paps over girlfriend Mahieka's photo Hardik Pandya has criticised paparazzi for invading his girlfriend Mahieka Sharma's privacy when she was returning from a restaurant in Mumbai on Tuesday. He emphasised the need for dignity and boundaries, urging media to act responsibly.

Pooja Tomar vows to guide India's next fighters, plans MMA academy she never had Pooja Tomar wants India's next generation of fighters to receive the guidance she never had. Her dream of opening an academy aims to give young athletes real opportunities, structure and support from the very start.

Mohammed Shami sends strong message to selectors with 4-wicket haul vs Haryana Mohammed Shami delivered a four-wicket haul against Haryana in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2025–26. His consistent domestic performances raise questions about his continued exclusion from the national team despite proven fitness.

Ashes blow for England: Mark Wood ruled out as injury saga rumbles on Fast bowler Mark Wood has been ruled out of the remaining Ashes series after suffering a recurrence of his left knee injury during the first Test in Perth. England will be without their express pacer after having gone 0-2 down in the five-match series.

Mumbai Indians IPL 2026 auction strategy explained: Five players MI can target Mumbai Indians (MI) will head into the IPL 2026 auction with the lowest purse amount among all ten franchises. However, they have most of their squad fixed and only need to fix a few holes in their otherwise formidable squad.

Ashwin drops bombshell: Nathan Lyon is lucky, I can't vent my frustration like him R Ashwin said he can't freely express frustration without backlash, calling Nathan Lyon lucky for openly venting after being dropped. Lyon admitted feeling filthy and angry after missing out on selection for the second Ashes Test against England in Brisbane earlier this month.

Venkatesh Iyer and Steve Smith headline IPL 2026 top prize bracketThe IPL 2026 auction's top bracket features 40 players who have listed themselves at the Rs 2 crore base price. From Cameron Green to Venkatesh Iyer, several marquee names headline a high-stakes bidding battle.

Hardik, Axar on cusp of historic landmarks as India eye T20I series win vs South AfricaIndia and South Africa are set to clash in a five-match T20I series, starting December 9 in Cuttack. After losing the Test series, India bounced back to win the ODI series and will now aim to carry that momentum into the T20Is.

350 players in auction shortlist, in-form wicketkeeper makes surprise entryThe BCCI has unveiled the full list of players finalised for the IPL 2026 auction scheduled to be held in Abu Dhabi on December 16. 240 Indians and 110 overseas players will go under the hammer during the bidding event.

Josh Hazlewood ruled out of Ashes, Pat Cummins set to return for Adelaide TestAustralia fast bowler Josh Hazlewood has been ruled out of the entire Ashes series due to an Achilles injury. However, captain Pat Cummins is set to return for the third Test, bolstering Australia's pace attack as they hope to secure an unassailable 3-0 series lead.

Rohit Sharma helped me feel comfortable, play freely in early career: Shardul ThakurShardul Thakur said Rohit Sharma helped him play freely during his early years. The Mumbai Indians all-rounder credited Rohit's support for shaping his confidence and comfort as he prepares for a homecoming season in IPL 2026.

Has Salah already played his last Liverpool game? Arne Slot has no clueArne Slot's admission that he has "no clue" about Mohamed Salah's future deepened Liverpool's ongoing uncertainty. The fallout from Salah's interview has left the club navigating one of its most delicate moments of the season.

IND vs SA 1st T20I, Cuttack weather report: Will rain play spoilsport?IND vs SA: India will face South Africa in a five-match T20I series starting December 9 at Barabati Stadium. There are slight chances of rain ahead of the first T20I in Cuttack.

Can Suryakumar Yadav rediscover his best form with T20 World Cup looming large?IND vs SA: Suryakumar Yadav hasn't had the best of years in T20Is, but has a chance to regain his form in India's five-match T20I series against South Africa, starting December 9 in Guwahati.

1st T20I: Coach Gambhir back to his comfort zone as India begin World Cup pushIND vs SA 1st T20I preview: Coach Gautam Gambhir returns to his favourite hunting ground as reigning world champions India begin their official march towards the home T20 World Cup with the opening match of a five-game series against South Africa.

Smriti Mandhana's latest Instagram post goes viral: Calm isn't silenceSmriti Mandhana's latest Instagram post has set the internet ablaze with fans implying that there is more to the caption than what meets the eye.

Ex-World No.4 turns down 270000-dollar offer from betting company in bold moveFormer World No.4 Caroline Garcia turned down a 270,000 dollars betting sponsorship for her podcast, prioritising athlete welfare and integrity over money.

Salah dropped from Liverpool's Champions League squad vs Inter after public outburstMohamed Salah has been left out of Liverpool's squad for their Champions League match against Inter Milan following his public criticism of the club and manager Arne Slot. The Egyptian forward, set to participate in the Africa Cup of Nations with Egypt later this month, was not named among the 19 players travelling to Italy, raising questions about his future at Anfield.

Hardik Pandya opts out of training, Gill returns with intense two-hour net sessionIND vs SA, 1st T20I: Hardik Pandya skipped India's training session as a precaution ahead of the T20I opener, while Shubman Gill returned with a long, intense batting stint in Cuttack.

Shreyas Iyer's next scan in December, rehab plan to follow after specialist reviewAll eyes are on Shreyas Iyer's mid-December scan, which will decide when he can begin rehab at the COE and take his first real step back towards competitive cricket.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma having to prove themselves is laughable: R AshwinFormer India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has slammed the critics questioning Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, insisting the iconic duo have nothing left to prove at this stage of their careers.

SMAT 2025: Sai Sudharsan back in T20 mode after poor Test form, hits 100 in AhmedabadSMAT 2025: After a poor run of form in Test cricket, Sai Sudharsan found his mojo in the shorter format, slamming a hundred for Tamil Nadu in Ahmedabad.

SMAT: After KKR retention, Ajinkya Rahane makes strong statement with unbeaten 95Ajinkya Rahane sent a strong reminder of his value to KKR with an unbeaten 95 that powered Mumbai to a nine-wicket win over Odisha and secured their top spot in Elite Group A of the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy.

Brendon McCullum echoes Ben Stokes' weak men remark: England can't have a glass jawEngland head coach Brendon McCullum has urged his team to stay tough and fully committed as they face a must-win situation in the Ashes after going 0–2 down in Australia.

How South Africa plan to counter in-form Abhishek Sharma in T20I series vs IndiaSouth Africa T20I captain Aiden Markram put a premium on Abhishek Sharma's wicket, saying the new-age Indian opener embodies the fearless and ultra-aggressive style of play that has reshaped the format.

IND vs SA 1st T20I Predicted XIs: Sanju Samson vs Jitesh Sharma in wicketkeeper raceIND vs SA 1st T20I Predicted XIs: Selection intrigue peaks in Cuttack as India weigh their options for the wicketkeeper with the Samson–Jitesh duel, Gill's return and Nortje's comeback shaping a gripping start to the T20I series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
